ticket.title: url_for not matching route
ticket.original-body:
My routes.rb looks like this:
namespace :workflow do resources :articles, :except => [:index, :new, :create] do resources :revisions, :controller => "articles/revisions" do get 'body', :on => :member end end end
When I call body_workflow_article_revision in my view, it raises an ActionController::RoutingError: No route matches {:controller=>"workflow/articles/revisions", :action=>"body"} The same thing happens when I try using url_for.
ticket.latest-body:
My routes.rb looks like this:
namespace :workflow do resources :articles, :except => [:index, :new, :create] do resources :revisions, :controller => "articles/revisions" do get 'body', :on => :member end end end
When I call body_workflow_article_revision in my view, it raises an ActionController::RoutingError: No route matches {:controller=>"workflow/articles/revisions", :action=>"body"} The same thing happens when I try using url_for.
ticket.original-body-html:
My routes.rb looks like this:

namespace :workflow do

resources :articles, :except => [:index, :new, :create] do
  resources :revisions, :controller => "articles/revisions" do
    get 'body', :on => :member
  end
end

end

When I call body_workflow_article_revision in my view, it raises an ActionController::RoutingError:
No route matches {:controller=>"workflow/articles/revisions", :action=>"body"} The same thing happens when I try using url_for.

resources :articles, :except => [:index, :new, :create] do

    get 'body', :on => :member

When I call body_workflow_article_revision in my view, it raises an ActionController::RoutingError:
No route matches {:controller=>"workflow/articles/revisions", :action=>"body"} The same thing happens when I try using url_for.
version.title: url_for not matching route

version.body: Works fine here - are you passing :article_id and :id to the url helper / url_for ?
version.body-html: Works fine here - are you passing :article_id and :id to the url helper / url_for ?
